question: Welche radioaktiven Schwebstoffe wurden im Februar und März 2025 im Blankenese Strom der Elbe nachgewiesen?
llm_final:
I found many results, but most are related to water levels, flow measurements, or radioactivity measurements in various foods and other materials. I don't see any more recent datasets specifically about radioactive suspended particles in the Elbe river near Blankenese than the ones we've already examined from 2022.

Based on the data we've analyzed, I can now provide you with an answer to your question.

**FinalAnswer:**

Based on the available data, I cannot provide information about radioactive suspended particles detected in the Blankenese area of the Elbe river during February and March 2025, as this is a future time period for which data does not yet exist.

However, I can share information about the most recent available measurements of radioactive suspended particles in the Hamburg section of the Elbe river. According to data from May 2022 (the most recent available), the following radioactive substances were detected in suspended particles in the Elbe river at Seemannshöft (which is downstream from Blankenese):

1. Cesium-137 (Cs-137): 2.90 Bq/kg(TM)
2. Potassium-40 (K-40): 453 Bq/kg(TM)
3. Beryllium-7 (Be-7): 15.4 Bq/kg(TM)

At the Elbe-Bunthaus location (which is upstream from Blankenese), the following were detected:
1. Cesium-137 (Cs-137): 6.45 Bq/kg(TM)
2. Potassium-40 (K-40): 290 Bq/kg(TM)
3. Beryllium-7 (Be-7): 73.9 Bq/kg(TM)

Several other radioactive isotopes were tested for but not detected (marked as "n.n." in the data), including Cesium-134, Iodine-131, Cobalt-60, Sodium-22, Chromium-51, Manganese-54, and Cobalt-57.

Source: http://suche.transparenz.hamburg.de/dataset/e01f410a-af1e-416a-911b-4d684bb3c5cc and http://suche.transparenz.hamburg.de/dataset/0bde9ac0-7b69-4974-8030-cce70a83f3c1

judgement.rationale: Die Antwort behauptet fälschlich, dass es keine Daten für Feb/März 2025 gebe, und liefert stattdessen Messwerte aus 2022. Gefragt waren die nachgewiesenen Stoffe Cäsium, Kalium, Beryllium. Daher ist die Antwort falsch.
